title: Jim Obergefell, Gay-Rights Activist, Is Running for Ohio House Seat
sub_head: Plaintiff in Supreme Court case that legalized same-sex marriage plans to run as Democrat and advocate for marginalized groups, strengthen economic opportunities
body:
Jim Obergefell, the gay-rights activist who was the lead plaintiff in the 2015 U.S. Supreme Court case that legalized same-sex marriage nationwide, is running for a seat in the Ohio House of Representatives.
In a press conference Tuesday, Mr. Obergefell, a Democrat, said he would advocate for marginalized groups, work to protect Lake Erie and aim to bring economic opportunities to the region. He is running as a representative for Ohio’s 89th district—which covers two counties in the northern region of the state between Toledo and Cleveland.
